'jtron' connected
'jtron' disconnected

The Merchant's Lair is a gargantuan straw alehouse. As you draw nearer you notice a group of women wearing all black forming a circle around the building.

Hrobel: [SKILL] Nature [1d20 = 6]
Mathris Harrick is a rather scrawny looking half elf. His clothes, though once opulent are threadbare, worn at the elbows. He wears the robe of a courtier over studded leather armour of serviceable design. In his hand he holds an odd looking staff. Its head is carved in the form of an odd squid like creature with a number of tentacles. The number is different every time you count them, if you can be bothered too. Its eyes glint - brighter when they have nothing to reflect, oddly.
Sol'eran: Mathris Harrick is a rather scrawny looking half elf. His clothes, though once opulent are threadbare, worn at the elbows. He wears the robe of a courtier over studded leather armour of serviceable design. In his hand he holds an odd looking staff. Its head is carved in the form of an odd squid like creature with a number of tentacles. The number is different every time you count them, if you can be bothered too. Its eyes glint - brighter when they have nothing to reflect, oddly.

Awarded XP to the Party. (20)
Mathris Harrick: Mathris Harrick is a rather scrawny looking half elf. His clothes, though once opulent are threadbare, worn at the elbows. He wears the robe of a courtier over studded leather armour of serviceable design. In his hand he holds an odd looking staff. Its head is carved in the form of an odd squid like creature with a number of tentacles. The number is different every time you count them, if you can be bothered too. Its eyes glint - brighter when they have nothing to reflect, oddly. His familiar owl, Cthoot is also odd looking. Its eyes have odd shaped pupils that seem to writhe. Also, and this may just be a trick of the light, its tongue seems to have a tentacle like appearance when glimpsed from the corner of your eye.

Kendal: Golden Skin, golden hair, ruby eyes. Those are only the most notable features of the large looming figure clad in white costume, and wielding a glassy white staff . Kendal's natural radiance in every room casts brighter light and stronger shadows.

[Random - Dungeon - Cave - Forshadowing - CR 03]
Mr. Pumpkin 1: [TABLE] Random - Dungeon - Cave - Forshadowing - CR 03 [d5=2] = [2]
Forshadowing - Knight of the Order of Vinoa
Mr. Pumpkin 1: [TABLE] Forshadowing - Knight of the Order of Vinoa [d1=1] = [1]
[RESULT] Boss = Kight of the Order of Vinoa
[RESULT] Forshadow 1 = A silver bowl with 6 CP.
[RESULT] Forshadow 2 = A silver basin filed with water.
[RESULT] Forshadow 3 = An anvil melded into the floor and shrouded with an inch of ice.
[RESULT] Forshadow 4 = A statue of a fair maiden with arms wide open as if welcoming someone.
[RESULT] Current Purpose of Location = Binding something that Vinoa considers dangerous to her plans in the world. Whether it is a source of extreme good that would hinder her plots, or an ancient rival darker than she, she has locked them away and bound the lock to these four items. They must stay near the lock or the lock will weaken then break. She is bonded with each of the items and can choose to listen or hear through them.

Doris: After adventuring through a cave system, I became overwhelmed by my masters power, attacking a holy creature and dishonoring myself. I was cursed with lesser size for my crime, with I bare fully. I then found a cove of Religious Kobalds, where
Doris: I found an Axe I believe is linked to my Master, that I must not part with.
'jtron' disconnected
Ronn: Doris my gnome adventuring partner and myslef wandered through a burned area to the North, while trying to aviod more dangerous areas the townsfolk had warned us of. We ran into a pumpkin garden thats water fed from a foul magic well, animating the vines to violence. So we looked for other options when a second pumpkin patch appeared before us. A painting cursed Doris with greater size inside the well hidden opening we wander through. We found a talking mouse in very small but spacious temple, thinking the mouse possessed by evil we attacked. We settled matters peacefully, but Doris was left in a tiny state. In the second mound we entered we quickly stold a magic axe from a trapped chest from under a kobold gos's statue. Doris attuned to the axe to discover its power. It was unfortunately a cursed berzerker's axe...
Ronn: Doris and I wandered far and wide avoiding too much direct contact with evil, unfortunately we came into contact with two too many curses, one from a good mouse another from a kobold deity's statue's axe. Otherwise things went well...

'Keggy' disconnected
GM: Description A king in ancient times tripped over a porcupine discovered that thier spines can find and pierce the boundaries between plate bodies. He deicded that these humble creatures might be the salvation of his empire from the demon hoard. If their spines could get past his plate body then they could also get past the tough demon scales. He ordered his magicians to make them larger and to find a way to reinforce thier spines with cold iron. And so a new monstrosity was born... The Sprillon are giant porcupines taht have an insatiable hunber for two things. First they hunger for iron and will eat it anywhere they can find it. They have been known to slowly knaw through the swords and armor of their victims. This hunger is driven by the need for the iron to go up and reinforce their spikes. Their second great hunger is for demons. The wizards decided to give this hunger so that it drove them towards the empires greatest enemy. Unfortunately the habit of eating demons has warped the Sprillons over time. On one hand thier have gained a telekenetic ability allowing them to throw their spines and enabling them to take down demons much easier. The downside is that it has corrupted them so that they are both chaotic and evil. They will still take out demons... but when those are not around they will take on pigs, cows, or even humans. Forshadowing A gnawed pile of bones. A half eaten sword. Two foot tunnels with a lot of scratch marks and some iron spikes in the walls. A fresh body pincushioned by iron needles. Starting Text Battle Taunts Death Speech

GM: UG another typo. I'll track that one down too (warhammer)

GM: when leveling up you don't type to change the number...
GM: you drag your cleric overtop of your cleric
Krovax Garakson: Oh
GM: this way it automatically searches for your features and adds them
GM: and also increases your max hitpoints...
GM: otherwise you will splat with lvl 1 hit points at lvl 20 :)

GM: already fixed that for you
GM: just go ahead and do it right now

GM: I also gave you your antiquian equipment
Krovax Garakson: yep already put it in backpack ty :)
GM: and its not much work to track down those typos once I know where they are at
GM: it is finding them that is all of the trouble
Krovax Garakson: Hmm, lvling this way I guess it gives the average hitpoints as mentionned ? No rolling ?
GM: yup
GM: that is standard so that we don't have to log what you rolled
GM: keeps people from claiming they always rolled a max number
GM: you get 1 max roll for lvl 1 then the average... which is rounded up
GM: so your d8 gives you an automatic 5
GM: it also changes your spell slots on the action tab
GM: but you will still need to pick your spells manually
Krovax Garakson: Is it for creation only ? Or lvling up process after adventuring is a fixed value too for hp ?
GM: leveling is the same process
GM: most leagues are like this...
Krovax Garakson: Ok ok
GM: makes it much harder to cheat... given it also does remove some of the fun
Krovax Garakson: I just love too much RNG :)
GM: hold that thought one minute while I pull something...
Krovax Garakson: But for the other way... I love having shitty rolls and having to do with it.
GM: you get 3 cantrips...
GM: do you want to pick them or roll them?
Krovax Garakson: Roll is fine :)
Krovax Garakson: [TABLE] Cleric - Spell - Cantrip [d7=1] = [1]
[RESULT] Guidance
Krovax Garakson: [TABLE] Cleric - Spell - Cantrip [d7=2] = [2]
[RESULT] Light
Krovax Garakson: [TABLE] Cleric - Spell - Cantrip [d7=7] = [7]
[RESULT] Spare the Dying
GM: a bold man... drag those nobs into your spells under the actions tab
Krovax Garakson: [TABLE] Cleric - Spell - Cantrip [d7=1] = [1]
GM: you get your wisdom modifier + cleric level of spells... that means 2+3=5 from level 1 and 2
GM: most people split that 3 lvl 1 and 2 lvl 2
Krovax Garakson: You mean prepared ? I'm a bit rusty on how spell works but if I remember well, cleric knows every spell of his domain, but has to pray for the ones he want every day, is it still like this ?
GM: it is indead, and I do mean prepared
GM: you can open spells in the right hand side and search for the specific lists
Krovax Garakson: On my sheet I have $ lvl 1 slots and 2 lvl 2 slots... Which seems to differ from what you're saying.
Krovax Garakson: 4 lvl 1 slots and 2 lvl 2 slots *
GM: spell slots differ from spells prepared
GM: spell slots is how many times you can cast spells at certain levels.
GM: Think of it like money
Krovax Garakson: Ok that's where I may be confused...
Krovax Garakson: Oh
GM: you have 4 $1 and 2 $2 that you can spend each day
Krovax Garakson: So I could prepare one lvl 1 spell, but cast it 4 times ?
GM: you can spend that on any spells you have prepared
GM: you can prepare your wisdom (2) plus your cleric level (3)
GM: so you are walking into a store with 5 different items available for purchase... and you get to choose them each long rest!
GM: poor wizards only get 1 per level added to their store, you can change them each time you fall asleep, wake up and spend the time needed meditating
GM: (essentially... at the start of every session, and maybe once during the session)
Krovax Garakson: I still get a bit confused on the difference between slots and preparation... Let say I do a split : 3 lvl 1 and 2 lvl 2 prepared... I get that point ok I think...
Krovax Garakson: But then
Krovax Garakson: I'm allowed to cast 4 lvl 1 and 2 lvl 2 per day ( which is how I understand what you say about slots )
Krovax Garakson: Does that mean that the number of times I cast a spell has no correlation with the prepared spells ?
Krovax Garakson: I mean... I could cast 4 times the same one of my lvl 1 prepared ?
GM: you are correct
GM: we can ask others to confirm this if you wish... but that is they way I understand it.
Krovax Garakson: Ok
GM: You can spend all your money on the one item...
GM: 4 regular uses and 2 supercharged uses
Krovax Garakson: Preparation is the daily catalog in which I pick in any way I wnat my castings ( under the slot lvl limit of course )
GM: lets use cure wounds (a staple cleric spell) as an example
GM: at level 1 it heals 1d8 + your spellcasting modifier (wisdom)
GM: for each level above 1 you add 1d8
GM: so at lvl 2 it heals 2d8+2
GM: (your modifier does not change with higher levels)
GM: so the clerc does not give change... but will give you a bigger version of the spell most times
GM: and true, you technically select 5 lvl 2 spells... but it would make it very difficult if not impossible ot use your lvl 1 slots
GM: (I don't think you can use cantrips in higher slots... but I would need to look that up. If possible no one has wanted to try)
Krovax Garakson: Ok understood.
Krovax Garakson: Hmm.
Krovax Garakson: To put them as prepared, should I change the mode under spells ?
Krovax Garakson: Also, am I not only limited to my divine domain spells ?
GM: normally I just add the prepared ones to my actions
GM: and you are limited to 1) cleric spells and/0r 2) domain
GM: ie... the domain adds to your list but you do have broader access
Krovax Garakson: Oh ok so I should check both list, like general cleric list + life domain list right ? That would be my overall spell access ?
GM: yup
GM: you can do that from the spell selector (right hand side of the screen) this lets you search for spells by "source" and by "level"
Krovax Garakson: Or are they automatically added to the cleric list, I'm reading the first lvls and I find the life domain ones in the cleric list.

GM: XD it does not say one way or the other....

GM: that means yoru cure wounds will do 1d8+2(wisdom)+3(disciple of life)
GM: and at level 2 that would be 2d8+2+4

[understood by: Feldis Harlequin]
Feldis Harlequin [Plainstongue]: Little guys with stick, you say. Would they happen to be the ones who live in the tower south-west.
[understood by: Feldis Harlequin]
GM [Plainstongue]: that tower? no that is a mean tower. The things that live there are close to them but much much meaner
[understood by: Feldis Harlequin]
Feldis Harlequin [Plainstongue]: I must say, it is strange to see a lone creature like yourself. Do you have a herd, or is it just you?
[understood by: Feldis Harlequin]
GM [Plainstongue]: There were many of my kind once. But one by one the stick men have taken them away...
[understood by: Feldis Harlequin]
